timeline.message:
Add OfflineAreaRepository; Download OfflineAreas + add to the DB

- Add a GEO_JSON_SOURCE constant to Config.java
- Add a method to insert or update offline areas in the local data store
- Add an offlineAreaRepository for working with offline areas

Trigger offline area downloads from the OfflineAreaSelector

Upon clicking "download" we queue up an area download using the
OfflineAreaRepository.

Render tile overlays on the map

- Update MapboxOfflineTileProvider to look open tile database files on
  demand (this is necessary because we store tiles in separate mbtiles
  files).
- Render a tileOverlay on map ready.
- Use timber in MapContainerFragment
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into offline-areas
Fix imports
Fix offline area selector layout

timeline.author: shobhitagarwal1612

timeline.bodyText:
Can source be omitted from the comments? I'm guessing that the settings are generic and don't have anything specific to do with the source or destination. Also, then GEO_JSON_CONFIG_FILENAME.
Thoughts?
timeline.author: shobhitagarwal1612

replies.bodyText: I went with source because it's possible that we'll use a URL in the future instead of a file on the device...maybe just GEO_JSON would suffice with a more detailed comment?

- Return Completable.error on FileNotFoundExceptions.

timeline.author: shobhitagarwal1612

timeline.bodyText: I'm guessing that FileNotFoundException can only be raised while attempting to load the json file, right? If yes, then we should only wrap the first line of the method with try-catch. Sorry, I somehow missed this earlier.
timeline.author: shobhitagarwal1612

replies.bodyText: That would make sense, but as far as I can tell, Java scopes declarations to try blocks, so any code that needs to use the declared variable has to also be wrapped in the block—to restrict the block to the assignment only we'd have to separate the declaration from the assignment which would result in some extra checks, I think, in this case....I'm not super familiar w/ Java though, is there a common idiom we can use to get around this?
replies.author: scolsen
shobhitagarwal1612

timeline.message: Use Timber.e instead of Timber.e
OfflineAreaRepository: Separate declaration and assignment of jsonSource

Add gnd-geojson; update fileUtil to access raw resources

At the moment, we're using an on-device json file to source mbtiles for
download. We have to bundle the file with the application, so I've added
it as a raw resource.

Accessing the file's contents also requires an additional method in the
FileUtil helper, since android's openRawResource returns an input stream
not a File; it's not the most efficient solution, but in order to have
a small delta and make it easier to change this in the future, I've
implemented a method that copies the inputstream to a file corresponding
to the config name--this allows us to make a drop-in replacement--the
alternative requires rewriting the logic of the json parser, which would
need to change yet again as soon as we no longer use a raw resource, so
I felt this was an appropriate approach for now, even though the stream
to file conversion is redundant.
Handle addAreaAndEnqueue errors downstream.

Prepend files dir to GEO_JSON file write.

The root directory is a read only file system--we need to write the file
to the app's data dir.

As mentioned in a previous commit, this extraneous write will hopefully
be eliminated in the future.
Remove unused import

timeline.bodyText:
This copies the raw file to /data dir each time the function is called. Instead, let's first try to load the file from Config.GEO_JSON and save a copy to data dir only when FileNotFound exception gets raised. That logic should probably be added to getFileFromRawResource() in fileutil
wdyt?
timeline.author: shobhitagarwal1612

timeline.message: Only load geojson from raw resource if it doesn't exist in /data
Merge branch 'master' into offline-areas
